page.title: 03Riccall's Lost Railway Line.
page.content: The Railway in Riccall,Mount Park had been there for many years. All sorts of trains ran on the lines, like the 125 Intercity trains between York and London,and smaller trains,for the local York/Selby service. The County Council are digging up the old line for a by_pass road around Riccall.The railway now (22.6.85.) is nearly cleared. The new line has been built on the other side of the River Ouse. The National Coal Board built the new line for British Rail,as the old line was to be effected by subsidence from the new Selby Coal field.
